algorithm_technique: hash table to store max y for each x, then quickselect to find top 3 distinct x values
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum sum of y values from three entries with distinct x values.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a hash map to store the maximum y for each unique x, then applies quickselect to find the top K distinct y values.
key_insights: Group prizes by their x-coordinate and take the maximum y for each x.
If there are fewer than 3 distinct x-values, no triplet can be formed.
Quickselect (or sorting) is used to efficiently find the largest y-values corresponding to distinct x-values.
